headline.seo: N.H.L. and Players Union Take Lead on Gay Issues With You Can Play Project
headline.main: N.H.L. and Players Union Take Lead on Gay Issues
headline.print_headline: N.H.L. Puts Itself in Lead on Gay Issues

docs.snippet: The N.H.L. has formed a partnership with a gay advocacy group to plan training and counseling on gay issues, and the N.F.L. is looking to smooth the way for acceptance....
docs.lead_paragraph: The N.H.L. has formed a partnership with a gay advocacy group to plan training and counseling on gay issues, and the N.F.L. is looking to smooth the way for acceptance.
docs.abstract: Four major professional sports leagues in the United States, with growing expectations that gay male athlete will soon come out publicly for first time, are exploring ways to accommodate and respond to announcement; National Hockey League forms partnership with gay advocacy group to plan training and counseling on gay issues, and National Football League is looking to smooth the way for acceptance.

headline.seo: Major Pro Leagues Prepare for the ‘I’m Gay’ Announcement
headline.main: Major Sports Leagues Prepare for the ‘I’m Gay’ Disclosure
headline.print_headline: Major Sports Leagues Prepare For the ‘I’m Gay’ Disclosure

docs.lead_paragraph:
11:05 p.m. | Updated 

 
The payments came in various forms. There were envelopes of $100 bills wrapped in $10,000 bundles. There were expensive tickets to a Bruce Springsteen concert. There was a 2011 Rolex Cosmograph Daytona valued at $12,000.
docs.abstract: Prosecutors file criminal charges against Scott I London, former senior executive at accounting giant KPMG; accusations lay bare brazen insider trading scheme in which London took lucrative bribes from Los Angeles jeweler Bryan Shaw, who cooperated with federal investigation. Photos (M)

headline.main: Ex-KPMG Partner Is Charged in Insider Case

docs.snippet: Silicon Valley is battling in Washington to make the immigration process easier for people with skills coveted by the technology sector....
docs.lead_paragraph: Silicon Valley is battling in Washington to make the immigration process easier for people with skills coveted by the technology sector.
docs.abstract: Silicon Valley is aggressively lobbying to streamline immigration process for thousands of foreign workers who compose increasingly vital part of technology sector; top priorities are fast-track green cards for math and science graduates and significant increase in visas for temporary workers.

headline.main: Tech Firms Push to Hire More Workers From Abroad
headline.print_headline: Waiting and Waiting for Green Cards
